title: Build tmux pane monitor for AI completion detection
description: Background thread that monitors all tmux panes for AI activity state. Uses tmux capture-pane to periodically read pane contents. Detects: (1) AI is working (output still streaming, no prompt visible), (2) AI is idle/done (prompt returned, waiting for input), (3) AI errored (error patterns in output). Patterns to detect: Claude Code '>' prompt, shell '$' prompt, 'error'/'failed' keywords. Fires callbacks when state changes. Polling interval: 2-3 seconds.
close_reason: tmux capture-pane polling, detects IDLE/WORKING/ERRORED states via regex patterns

close_reason: Created complete orchestration playbook and tested system

title: Select and integrate TTS engine
description: Research and integrate the fastest, most accurate TTS. Candidates: OpenAI TTS API (best quality, ~$0.015/1K chars), edge-tts (Microsoft Edge, free, excellent quality, needs internet), piper (local neural TTS, fast, decent). Criterion: natural voice, low latency (<500ms to first audio), streaming support. Build a tts.py module with a simple speak(text) interface that streams audio via PulseAudio.
close_reason: edge-tts with en-GB-RyanNeural voice, streams MP3 to ffplay

title: Implement alert and notification system
description: Notifies user when events occur. Channels: (1) TTS announcement via speak(), (2) desktop notification via notify-send, (3) tmux status bar flash. Events: task completed, task errored, AI idle, summary requested. Priority-based: critical alerts always speak, low-priority just notify. Queue-based to avoid overlapping TTS.
close_reason: Integrated into main.py: notify-send desktop notifications + TTS announcements on pane state changes (WORKING→IDLE, errors), debounced

title: Implement Claude API conversation brain
description: Persistent conversation with Claude API that serves as the orchestrator brain. System prompt: you manage AI instances in tmux windows, you can assign tasks, check status, report results. Tool use: send_to_window(num, text), check_window_status(num), create_bead(title), close_bead(id), list_active_tasks(), get_window_output(num). Maintains conversation history for context. Uses claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 for speed, falls back to opus for complex reasoning.
close_reason: Claude Sonnet API with tool use: send_to_window, check_window, list_windows, switch_window, cancel_window, run_beads_command

title: Implement wake word detection (Hey Claude / Claude)
description: Always-listening wake word detection using openwakeword or porcupine. Must detect 'Hey Claude' and 'Claude' reliably with low false-positive rate. Runs as a background thread in the orchestrator daemon. On detection: play activation beep, start recording user speech, transcribe with Whisper. Must be low CPU when idle. Consider: openwakeword (open source, custom trainable), porcupine (Picovoice, free tier for custom words).
close_reason: Whisper tiny.en on 2s chunks, checks for 'claude'/'hey claude' variants

title: Install ChromaDB + build RAG pipeline

title: Build orchestrator daemon (main process)
description: Main Python daemon that ties everything together. Runs in its own tmux window or as systemd service. Components: wake word listener thread, voice input (Whisper), AI brain (Claude API), TTS output, pane monitor, task router. State machine: IDLE (listening for wake word) -> LISTENING (recording speech) -> THINKING (API call) -> SPEAKING (TTS response) -> IDLE. Must handle interruptions gracefully (user speaks during TTS = stop speaking and listen).
close_reason: main.py orchestrator daemon: state machine IDLE→LISTENING→THINKING→SPEAKING, wake word + hotkey triggers, pane monitor callbacks, TTS notifications

title: Integration testing and end-to-end tuning
description: Wire all components together and test end-to-end flow: wake word -> speak -> AI reasons -> assigns task -> monitors -> alerts on completion -> speaks result. title: Voice AI Orchestrator - hands-free AI management via conversation
description: A persistent voice-driven AI orchestrator that manages all AI tmux windows. User speaks to it naturally (wake word: Hey Claude / Claude), it uses Claude API to reason about tasks, assigns work to other AI windows via tmux, monitors their progress, and speaks back results via TTS. Always-listening wake word detection, push-to-talk fallback via hotkey.
close_reason: All modules built and tested: TTS (edge-tts), wake word (Whisper tiny.en), brain (Codex CLI), pane monitor, task router, main daemon. End-to-end test passed. Systemd service created.

title: Build task router for sending commands to AI windows
description: Module that sends commands to specific tmux windows and tracks what was assigned where. Uses tmux send-keys and paste-buffer. Maintains a registry: {window_num: {ai_type, current_task, assigned_at, status}}. Supports: assign_task(window, prompt), cancel_task(window), get_assignments(). Integrates with beads to auto-create issues when tasks are assigned.
close_reason: tmux send-keys/paste-buffer with assignment tracking registry

title: Try implementing an XAUTH VPN setup so I can run GlobalProtect VPN from this Linux machine

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Added GlobalProtect openconnect config + connect script: Work/vpn/globalprotect/connect.sh and openconnect.conf with README.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Updated connect.sh default user to cwc00024. Test: openconnect --protocol=gp --user=cwc00024 --authenticate cyberemote.lcsee.wvu.edu failed with DNS error: getaddrinfo failed for host 'cyberemote.lcsee.wvu.edu' (name/service not known).

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Updated GP server to 157.182.7.112 in connect.sh and openconnect.conf. Test: openconnect --protocol=gp --user=cwc00024 --authenticate 157.182.7.112 failed: 'Failed to connect to host 157.182.7.112' and 'Failed to open HTTPS connection'.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Attempted --no-cert-check: openconnect reports option removed. Computed pin-sha256 servercert: ALFLmWEdylsZ6zjzE5Io3MBc8/bMokdtfnvWMcRoj1g=. openconnect --servercert pin-sha256:<pin> still failed: 'Failed to connect to host 157.182.7.112' / 'Failed to open HTTPS connection'.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Added /etc/hosts mapping cyberemote.lcsee.wvu.edu -> 157.182.7.112. Updated connect.sh to use hostname + servercert pin + --resolve. Updated openconnect.conf to hostname + pin; README updated. Verbose openconnect (escalated) connects and returns 512 auth-failed-password-empty when password is blank; TLS handshake works with SNI.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Added gateway cert pin (157.182.7.113) to openconnect.conf and connect.sh (second --servercert). README updated to mention portal+gateway pins.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: connect.sh now supports VPN_PASS env var to avoid interactive password prompt; README updated with example.

comments.author: Connor Cahill
comments.text: Coordination note: If user says 'connect to the vpn', all AIs should run Work/vpn/globalprotect/connect.sh (uses default user cwc00024; supports VPN_USER/VPN_PASS env vars) to connect GlobalProtect.
